page.title: 03HINXHILL ESTATE FARM 2
page.content: The farm is mixed. There are 207 dairy cows and 500 cows for finishing beef. These figures were taken 10th June 1985.The ages of cattle range from 1 week to 2 years. The dairy cows are a cross between British Freisian and a Canadian breed.The cross is made as the Canadian breed has a higher milk producing rate. The bulls are various breeds Hereford, Aberdeen Angus, Simmental and Limousin are present at the farm. None of the cattle are kept out in winter. All are housed from October to the end of April sometimes longer for the smaller cows. When the young bulls are anything from a day old the process of burning out their horns begins.A contraption rather like a blowlamp is placed on the horns and destroys them.Before this takes place each animal is given an anasthetic. When ready the bulls are sold for beef.
